abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Private Sector
            Promotion Credit for Guinea was marginally satisfactory. The
            project achieved some of its objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was modest, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, to maximize the impact of future PSD
            operations, consideration should be given to investment
            instruments. Second, in future operations, the
            Government's commitment, along with its action plan to
            implement difficult reforms, should be obtained prior to
            Board presentation. Third, the project's achievements
            should be measured only after sufficient time is allowed for
            the private sector to regain full confidence in the economy
            and react more favorably to the Government's
            pro-private sector policies. Fourth, it is important to
            conduct in-depth internalization work during project
            preparation. Finally, it is important to concentrate on a
            few essentials and resist pressure to overload a project
            with conditions.

repnme.cdata!: Guinea - Private Sector Promotion Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Promotion Credit will
            support a series of reforms aimed at improving the
            investment climate.  The program's objectives will be
            to establish a regulatory, incentive and institutional
            framework designed to improve the local business environment
            and to encourage both local and foreign promoters to
            undertake investments in productive activities.  Specific
            reforms targeted by the program include : 1) simplification
            of the legal regulatory framework : streamlining enterprise
            establishment and registration procedures, liberalization of
            labor regulations and establishment of a legl basis for
            private ownership rights on commercial buildings; 2)
            enhancement of the overall incentive structure : improving
            the effectiveness of the new tariff and investment regimes;
            3) increased effectiveness of the institutional framework
            for investment promotion; and 4) improving the policy and
            operational framework in the financial sector : deepening
            interest rate reforms, rationalization of credit markets,
            establishment of an improved legal framework for banking
            activity and strengthening the Central Bank's capacity
            to monitor activity in the banking sector.
